content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    # Initialize an empty array to store the filtered words
    capitalized_words = Array{String}(undef, 0)

    # Iterate over each word in the list and check if it starts with a capital letter
    for word in words
        if ismatch(r"^[A-Z]", word) # Check if the word starts with a capital letter
            push!(capitalized_words, word) # Add the word to the filtered array
        end
    end

    # Return the array of capitalized words
    return capitalized_words
end
```

This function uses a regular expression to check if each word starts with a capital letter and then filters out the words that do not match. It's important to note that this regex assumes that all capitalized names will start with an uppercase letter in the range `[A-Z]`, which is a common convention for English personal names.
